intro: Eriogonum flavissimum, commonly known as the yellow flax or goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a soft appearance. Eriogonum flavissimum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
